meanings.sent1: The map displayed the geographic features of the land.
meanings.sent2: She studied the geographic distribution of plants in different climates.
meanings.sent3: The geographic puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vast, unexplored geographic landscape.
meanings.sent5: The geographic boundaries between the two countries were clearly marked.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the natural features, population, industries, etc., of a region.
meanings.sent1: The geographic diversity of the area attracted tourists from all over.
meanings.sent2: Local businesses thrived due to the unique geographic location.
meanings.sent3: The geographic mix of people at the party made for interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a geographic landmark in the sea of frowns.
meanings.sent5: The geographic landmarks guided them through the unfamiliar terrain.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the science of geography.
meanings.sent1: The geographic research expedition aimed to map uncharted territories.
meanings.sent2: She pursued a career in geographic information systems.
meanings.sent3: The geographic study group met every Friday to discuss their findings.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of geographic principles was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The geographic data provided valuable insights for urban planning.
